title: The Spine's Mobility
description: A fast breakdown of The Spine's Mobility for builders.

hook.text: Your spine isn't one bone â€” it's 33 vertebrae stacked and linked. Each junction adds a little range.

buildup.text: The cervical spine (neck) rotates most. The thoracic (mid-back) extends. The lumbar (low back) flexes.

discovery.text: Most back pain comes from the lumbar spine doing jobs other segments should handle â€” especially rotation.

twist.text: A stiff thoracic spine forces the lower back to rotate. That's a mobility problem disguised as pain.

climax.text: Improving thoracic mobility is one of the fastest ways to reduce low back pain. Free the mid-back.

punchline.text: Back pain often starts where there's no pain â€” in the stiff segment above.

quiz.question: What commonly causes low back pain from a mobility perspective?
options: A stiff thoracic spine forcing the lumbar spine to rotate
Too much stretching of the lower back
